alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 4:36PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...MORE GUSTY NORTHEASTERLY WINDS WITH AREAS OF BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW POSSIBLE SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY... Enhanced northeasterly winds will continue across portions of the the Matanuska Valley. During this time, expect sustained winds of 15 to 30 mph with isolated gusts to 55 mph possible. These winds will persist through Monday morning before slowly diminishing through Monday afternoon and evening. There is no shortage of "transportable snow". Areas of blowing and drifting snow are expected with reductions to visibility possible, so expect challenging driving conditions. Travel with an emergency kit in your vehicle is advised. Additionally, windchill factors are already well below zero in Palmer through Chickaloon.
